alert.note: Alert for Eastern Monmouth; Middlesex; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 3:40PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Monmouth and east central Middlesex Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 340 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Matawan, or 8 miles southeast of Perth Amboy, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Middletown, Old Bridge, Tinton Falls, Holmdel, Red Bank, Keansburg, Matawan, Highlands, Brownville, Navesink, Lincroft, Eatontown, Keyport, Rumson, Little Silver, Oceanport, Shrewsbury, Strathmore, North Middletown and Laurence Harbor. This includes Garden State Parkway between mile markers 107 and 121. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
